message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Given the presentation and biopsy result, the most likely diagnosis is neuroblastoma. Elevation of vanillylmandelic acid (VMA) in the urine is a characteristic finding in neuroblastoma due to excess catecholamine production by the tumor cells. The other options are not specific to neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The biopsy result suggests neuroblastoma, and among the options, only Elevation of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine is a confirmatory test for neuroblastoma. MRI showing intrarenal origin of the mass indicates Wilms tumor, increased lactic dehydrogenase indicates muscle tissue damage or tumor, and radiograph of the bone showing the presence of lytic bone lesion with periosteal reaction indicates osteosarcoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of small round blue cells in the biopsy suggests neuroblastoma. Elevation of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine is a specific test for neuroblastoma. MRI showing intrarenal origin of the mass would suggest Wilms tumor, increased lactic dehydrogenase is a non-specific finding, and radiograph of the bone showing the presence of lytic bone lesion with periosteal reaction would suggest metastasis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question describes a possible neuroblastoma, a tumor of embryonic nerve cells. The biopsy shows small round blue cells, which is consistent with neuroblastoma. Among the options, the elevation of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine is a marker of neuroblastoma. The other options are not specific for neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The biopsy result of small round blue cells suggests neuroblastoma, which commonly originates in the adrenal gland. Elevated levels of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine are a marker of neuroblastoma. The other options are not specific to neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The biopsy result of small round blue cells suggests neuroblastoma, which commonly occurs in the adrenal gland. Among the options, elevation of vanillylmandelic acid (VMA) in the urine is a common finding in neuroblastoma. The other options suggest other possible diagnoses, such as Wilms tumor (A), lymphoma (C), or Ewing sarcoma (D).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the mass as small round blue cells along with the location in the adrenal gland suggests the possibility of neuroblastoma. Elevated vanillylmandelic acid in the urine is a common finding in neuroblastoma and would confirm the diagnosis. The other options are not specific to neuroblastoma and do not necessarily confirm the diagnosis.

The elevation of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine is a common finding in neuroblastoma and can confirm the diagnosis. The other options are not specific to neuroblastoma.

The elevation of vanillylmandelic acid in urine is a specific diagnostic marker for neuroblastoma. The other options are not specific to neuroblastoma.

Elevated vanillylmandelic acid in the urine is a common finding in patients with neuroblastoma. The other options are not specific to neuroblastoma.
